The Middle East is a complex and contested geographic and political concept. It refers to a region of the world that consists of the eastern Mediterranean Sea and the Persian Gulf, and includes countries such as Israel, Jordan, Palestine, Lebanon, Egypt, Iraq, and the United Arab Emirates. These countries have a diverse range of political systems and ideologies, from authoritarianism to democracy.
